module.name: curesec.CVE-2013-6272
module.description:
This plugin abuses a bug which allows a malicious app/user to use the com.android.phone without the necessary permissions.
CVE-2013-6272
http://www.curesec.com by Curesec Research Team security@curesec.com
Tested to be VULN: 4.2.2 4.3 4.4.2
Tested NOT VULN: 4.0.3 4.1.1 4.1.2

module.name: curesec.CVE-2013-6271
module.description:
This plugin abuses a bug which allows a malicious app/user to use the com.android.phone without the necessary permissions.
CVE-2013-6271
http://www.curesec.com by Curesec Research Team security@curesec.com
Tested to be VULN: 4.0 4.1 4.2 4.3
Tested NOT VULN: 4.4

module.name: curesec.CVE-2014-NA
module.description:
Bug in ContactsListActivity is abused to conduct phone calls or send special codes
CVE-2014-N/A
http://www.curesec.com by Curesec Research Team security@curesec.com

module.name: mwrlabs.develop
module.description: Start a Python shell, in the context of a drozer module.

module.name: mwrlabs.urls
module.description:
Finds URLs with the HTTP or HTTPS schemes by searching the strings inside APK files.
You can, for instance, use this for finding API servers, C&C servers within malicious APKs and checking for presence of advertising networks.

module.name: mwrlabs.secure_random
module.description:
Finds applications that make use of java.security.SecureRandom as a source of random numbers.
It was identified that on some versions of Android the SecureRandom random number generator did not correctly seed the underlying PRNG, which could cause predictable sequences of numbers to be generated.
See: http://android-developers.blogspot.co.uk/2013/08/some-securerandom-thoughts.html

module.name: metall0id.post.call
module.description: dz> run post.perform.call +27123456789 [*] Sent intent to call +27123456789

module.name: metall0id.post.screenshot
module.description: dz> run post.capture.screenshot Done. Saved at /home/user/1416002550.png

module.name: metall0id.post.contacts
module.description:
dz> run post.contacts.read
| Homer Simpson | 12345678901 | | Internet Support Centre | +27 20 7597 4131 | | James Bond | +4479445543007 |

module.name: metall0id.post.clipboard
module.description: dz> run post.capture.clipboard [*] Clipboard value: test123

module.name: metall0id.post.sms
module.description: dz> run post.sms.read -f otp | body | date_sent | address | person | | Fakey Bank. Payment OTP 1d5gv578 | 1366708779000 | +27731356743 | null | | Fakey Bank. Payment OTP a4g6h8jk | 1366708795000 | +27731356743 | null |

module.name: metall0id.post.microphone
module.description: dz> run post.capture.microphone /home/user/Desktop/test.3gp [*] Performing crazy reflection gymnastics [*] Preparing recorder attributes [+] Recording started [+] Press [Enter] to stop recording [+] Stopped...downloading recording [+] Done.

module.name: metall0id.post.disable_lockscreen
module.description:
This attack uses the DISABLE_KEYGUARD permission to disable the lock screen. KeyguardManager.KeyguardLock was supposedly deprecated in API 13 but disableKeyguard() still works on Android 4.4.2
Vulnerable: * Android - all versions

module.name: metall0id.post.screenrecord
module.description: dz> run post.capture.screenrecording Done. Saved at /home/user/1416002550.mp4

module.name: metall0id.tools.setup.nmap
module.description:
Installs Nmap on the Agent.
Nmap ("Network Mapper") is a free and open source (license) utility for network discovery and security auditing.

module.name: metall0id.root.ztesyncagent
module.description:
Exploit the setuid-root binary at /system/bin/sync_agent on certain ZTE devices to gain a root shell. It is as simple as providing it with the argument "ztex1609523", which is the hard-coded password in the binary.
This exploit has been reported to work on the ZTE Score M and the ZTE Skate.

module.name: metall0id.root.cmdclient
module.description:
Exploit the setuid-root binary at /system/bin/cmdclient on certain devices to gain a root shell. Command injection vulnerabilities exist in the parsing mechanisms of the various input arguments.
This exploit has been reported to work on the Acer Iconia, Motorola XYBoard and Motorola Xoom FE.

module.name: meatballs1.auxillary.port_forward
module.description: dz> run auxiliary.portforward -rh 192.168.5.1 -rp 5555 -lp 4444 Tunneling :4444 -> 192.168.5.1:5555 dz> Established tunnel to 192.168.5.1:5555

module.name: whfs.smsdraftsend
module.description: dz> run exploit.badauth.smsdraftsend -m "I <3 Drozer" -t 4015551212 [+] Drafting SMS message to send. [+] Calling app to send message to drafts. [+] Sending draft messages. [+] Message sent.

module.name: jubax.javascript
module.description:
Finds applications that make use of android.webkit.WebView.addJavascriptInterface or org.chromium.content.browser.addPossiblyUnsafeJavascriptInterface.
It was identified that using addJavascriptInterface with target sdk < 17 is problematic. There is also a new API, addPossiblyUnsafeJavascriptInterface, introduced in 4.4.2, which is target independent.
See: http://blog.k3170makan.com/2014/03/about-addjavascriptinterface-abuse-in.html

module.name: hh.idea.superbackup.contacts
module.description: Grabs Contact details backed up to the SD card by 'Super Backup : SMS & Contacts' (com.idea.backup.smscontacts).

module.name: hh.idea.superbackup.smses
module.description: Grabs SMS messages backed up to the SD card by 'Super Backup : SMS & Contacts' (com.idea.backup.smscontacts).

module.name: hh.idea.superbackup.calls
module.description: Grabs call logs backed up to the SD card by 'Super Backup : SMS & Contacts' (com.idea.backup.smscontacts).

module.name: hh.sophos.sophos_messages
module.description: Extracts the Messages database from Sophos Mobile Control (com.sophos.mobilecontrol.client.android), using a directory traversal vulnerability.

module.name: hh.inkpad.notes
module.description: Lists notes created with the InkPad application (com.workpail.inkpad.notepad.notes), and are exposed through a leaky content provider.

module.name: hh.seesmic.twitter.oauth_tokens
module.description: Extracts the Twitter Secret from Seesmic (com.seesmic), exposed through a leaky content provider.

module.name: hh.maildroid.emails
module.description: Grabs Email Messages stored on the SD card by 'MailDroid' (com.maildroid).
